text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.

title: Set up auxiliary models — auxiliary_model
text: Set auxiliary model differs target model.

title: Set up auxiliary models — auxiliary_model
code: auxiliary_model(   time_varying_variables,   time_invariant_variables,   linear,   heterogeneity,   use_open_mx,   verbose,   ... )

title: Set up auxiliary models — auxiliary_model
text: time_varying_variables List character vectors containing names time-varying variables. number entries list corresponds number univariate time-series. character vector contains time-ordered variable names univariate time-series starting first measurement occasion. time_invariant_variables List character vectors containing names time-invariant variables. List must length list argument time_varying_variables. linear Logical (TRUE = default / FALSE) indicating model linear observed variables (TRUE). heterogeneity Character vector indicating type unobserved heterogeneity. Admissible values "homogeneous", "additive", "autoregressive", "cross-lagged" (non-conflicting combination). use_open_mx Logical (TRUE / FALSE default) indicating lavaan (FALSE) OpenMx (TRUE) used. verbose Integer number describing verbosity console output. Admissible values: 0: output (default), 1: user messages, 2: debugging-relevant messages. ... used

title: Get Model Information — fill_in_info_model
text: internal_list list various information extracted model. time_varying_variables List character vectors containing names time-varying variables. Within vector, variable names must time-ordered starting first measurement ocassion. time_invariant_variables List character vectors containing names time-invariant variables. List must length list argument time_varying_variables. linear Logical (TRUE = default / FALSE) indicating model linear observed variables (TRUE). heterogeneity Character vector indicating type unobserved heterogeneity. Admissible values "homogeneous", "additive", "autoregressive", "cross-lagged" (non-conflicting combination). use_open_mx Logical (TRUE / FALSE default) indicating lavaan (FALSE) OpenMx (TRUE) used.

what: Fit Dynamic Panel Data Models — fit_panel_sem
title: Fit Dynamic Panel Data Models — fit_panel_sem
text: Fit model class dynamic panel data models longitudinal data. Models include linear nonlinear cross-lagged panel models additive nonadditive unobserved heterogeneity.

title: Fit Dynamic Panel Data Models — fit_panel_sem
code: fit_panel_sem(   data,   time_varying_variables,   time_invariant_variables,   linear = TRUE,   heterogeneity,   use_resamples = FALSE,   use_open_mx = FALSE,   verbose = 0,   ... )

title: Fit Dynamic Panel Data Models — fit_panel_sem
text: data data.frame containing data named columns. Data MUST wide format. time_varying_variables List character vectors containing names time-varying variables. number entries list corresponds number univariate time-series. character vector contains time-ordered variable names univariate time-series starting first measurement occasion. time_invariant_variables List character vectors containing names time-invariant variables. List must length list argument time_varying_variables. linear Logical (TRUE = default / FALSE) indicating model linear observed variables (TRUE). heterogeneity Character vector indicating type unobserved heterogeneity. Admissible values "homogeneous", "additive", "cross-lagged", c("additive","cross-lagged"). use_resamples Logical (TRUE / FALSE = default) indicating resampling procedure used computation starting values model diagnostics. use_open_mx Logical (TRUE / FALSE default) indicating lavaan (FALSE) OpenMx (TRUE) used. verbose Integer number describing verbosity console output. Admissible values: 0: output (default), 1: user messages, 2: debugging-relevant messages. ... used

title: Fit Dynamic Panel Data Models — fit_panel_sem
text: object class panelSEM.

title: Fit Dynamic Panel Data Models — fit_panel_sem
text: Gische, C., Voelkle, M.C. (2022) Beyond Mean: Flexible Framework Studying Causal Effects Using Linear Models. Psychometrika 87, 868–901. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11336-021-09811-z Gische, C., West, S.G., & Voelkle, M.C. (2021) Forecasting Causal  Effects Interventions versus Predicting Future Outcomes, Structural  Equation Modeling: Multidisciplinary Journal, 28:3, 475-492,  DOI: 10.1080/10705511.2020.1780598

title: Fit Dynamic Panel Data Models — fit_panel_sem
code: library(panelSEM) set.seed(23)  time_points <- 10  ############################################ # set values of population parameters SET 1 ############################################   # covariance-matrix of the latent traits A_sigma_eta <- matrix(nrow = 2, ncol = 2, c(1, 0.5, 0.5, 1)) sigma_epsilon_eta <- t(A_sigma_eta) %*% A_sigma_eta  # covariance-matrix of the epsilon_z variables A_sigma_z <- matrix(nrow = 3, ncol = 3, c(1, 0.75, 0.3, 0.75, 1, 0.25,                                           0.3, 0.25, 1)) sigma_epsilon_z <- t(A_sigma_z) %*% A_sigma_z  # covariance matrix of the initial residuals A_sigma_eps_init <- matrix(nrow = 2, ncol = 2, c(1, 2, 2, 1)) sigma_epsilon_init <- t(A_sigma_eps_init) %*% A_sigma_eps_init  population_parameters <- data.frame(   N = NA,   # directed effects   ## latent traits   c_x1_etax = -4,   c_x1_etay = 8,    c_y1_etax = -12,   c_y1_etay = 19,    c_x_etax = 1,   c_y_etay = 1,    ## time independent predictors   c_x1_z1 = -5,   c_x1_z2 = -1,   c_x1_z3 = 4,    c_y1_z1 = - 8,   c_y1_z2 = 2,   c_y1_z3 = 6,    c_x_z1 = 0.5,   c_x_z2 = 2,    c_y_z2 = 1.5,   c_y_z3 = 2,    ## autoregressive and cross-lagged effects   c_x_x = 0.05,   c_x_y = 0.4,   c_y_x = -0.6,   c_y_y = 1.2,    # undirected effects   ## trait   psi_etax_etax = sigma_epsilon_eta[1,1],   psi_etax_etay = sigma_epsilon_eta[1,2],   psi_etay_etay = sigma_epsilon_eta[2,2],    ## observed predictors   psi_z1_z1 = sigma_epsilon_z[1,1],   psi_z1_z2 = sigma_epsilon_z[1,2],   psi_z1_z3 = sigma_epsilon_z[1,3],   psi_z2_z2 = sigma_epsilon_z[2,2],   psi_z2_z3 = sigma_epsilon_z[2,3],   psi_z3_z3 = sigma_epsilon_z[3,3],    ## residuals   ### initial time point   psi_x1_x1 = sigma_epsilon_init[1,1],   psi_x1_y1 = sigma_epsilon_init[1,2],   psi_y1_y1 = sigma_epsilon_init[2,2],    ### subsequent time points   psi_x_x = 1,   psi_y_y = 1 )  population_parameters$N <- 1000  population_parameters$time_points <- time_points  data <- do.call(what = simulate_data,                 args = population_parameters) #> start of function simulate_data (0.0.2 2022-12-31) 2023-10-09 11:49:57.013572 #>   end of function simulate_data (0.0.2 2022-12-31) 2023-10-09 11:49:57.031485  model <- fit_panel_sem(data = data,                        time_varying_variables = list(paste0("x", 1:time_points),                                                      paste0("y", 1:time_points)),                        time_invariant_variables = list(c("z1", "z2"),                                                        c("z2", "z3")),                        heterogeneity = "additive")

title: simulate_data — simulate_data
text: N Integer number reflecting number units (e.g. persons). time_points Integer number reflecting number measurement occasions. c_x1_etax Numeric parameter value. c_y1_etax Numeric parameter value. c_x1_etay Numeric parameter value. c_y1_etay Numeric parameter value. c_x_etax Numeric parameter value. c_y_etay Numeric parameter value. c_x1_z1 Numeric parameter value. c_x1_z2 Numeric parameter value. c_x1_z3 Numeric parameter value. c_y1_z1 Numeric parameter value. c_y1_z2 Numeric parameter value. c_y1_z3 Numeric parameter value. c_x_z1 Numeric parameter value. c_x_z2 Numeric parameter value. c_y_z2 Numeric parameter value. c_y_z3 Numeric parameter value. c_x_x Numeric parameter value. c_x_y Numeric parameter value. c_y_x Numeric parameter value. c_y_y Numeric parameter value. psi_etax_etax Numeric parameter value. psi_etax_etay Numeric parameter value. psi_etay_etay Numeric parameter value. psi_z1_z1 Numeric parameter value. psi_z1_z2 Numeric parameter value. psi_z1_z3 Numeric parameter value. psi_z2_z2 Numeric parameter value. psi_z2_z3 Numeric parameter value. psi_z3_z3 Numeric parameter value. psi_x1_x1 Numeric parameter value. psi_x1_y1 Numeric parameter value. psi_y1_y1 Numeric parameter value. psi_x_x Numeric parameter value. psi_y_y Numeric parameter value.
